intro: Senecio flosculosus, commonly known as the small-flowered senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green. Senecio flosculosus is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
